response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for Token Code with Pytest in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document provides an overview of effective testing strategies for implementing unit tests using the popular Pytest framework within a Python 3.12+ environment for token-based code.
key_points: Understanding the importance of testing token-based code.
Setting up the project structure and installing pytest.
Writing unit tests using Pytest fixtures and assertions.
Exploring mocking techniques for external dependencies.
Creating parametrized tests to test multiple scenarios.
Using pytest plugins for enhancing testing capabilities.
Implementing test-driven development (TDD) for maintaining high code quality.

code_examples.code:
from unittest.mock import Mock

def test_tokenizer(tokenizer):
    mock_text = Mock(
        returns='mocked_text'
    )
    tokenized = tokenizer(mock_text)
    assert len(tokenized) == 5

caveats: Ensure to isolate tests using fixtures or mocking techniques.
Maintain readability and modularity in test cases.
Keep tests up-to-date with changes in the production code.
